name: Paracetamol 500mg
description: Paracetamol, also known as acetaminophen, is a common pain reliever and fever reducer.
uses: Used to treat mild to moderate pain (headache, toothache, muscle aches) and reduce fever.
how_it_works: Blocks the production of prostaglandins in the brain that signal pain and fever.
dosage: Adults: 500-1000mg every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 4000mg per day.
side_effects: Rare: allergic reactions, rash, liver damage (with overdose).
precautions: Avoid exceeding the recommended dose. Consult a doctor if you have liver disease or drink alcohol regularly.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Ibuprofen 400mg
description: Ibuprofen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, reduce inflammation, and lower fever.
uses: Used for headaches, muscle pain, arthritis, menstrual cramps, and fever reduction.
how_it_works: Blocks the production of prostaglandins, chemicals that cause pain and inflammation.
dosage: Adults: 200-400mg every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 3200mg per day unless directed by a doctor.
side_effects: Stomach upset, nausea, heartburn, dizziness, increased risk of bleeding, allergic reactions.
precautions: Avoid if you have ulcers, kidney disease, or are allergic to NSAIDs. Consult a doctor if pregnant or taking other medications.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Aspirin 100mg
description: Aspirin is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to reduce pain, fever, and inflammation, and as a blood thinner.
uses: Used for pain relief, fever reduction, and to reduce the risk of heart attack and stroke.
how_it_works: Blocks enzymes involved in producing prostaglandins, which cause pain and inflammation, and inhibits platelet aggregation.
dosage: Adults: 50-100mg daily for heart protection, or 325-650mg every 4-6 hours for pain. Do not exceed 4000mg per day.
side_effects: Stomach upset, heartburn, increased risk of bleeding, allergic reactions.
precautions: Avoid if you have bleeding disorders, ulcers, or are allergic to NSAIDs. Not for children with viral infections.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Acetaminophen 650mg
description: Acetaminophen is a pain reliever and fever reducer, commonly used for mild to moderate pain.
uses: Used for headaches, muscle aches, menstrual cramps, toothaches, and fever reduction.
how_it_works: Reduces pain signals in the brain and inhibits fever-regulating chemicals.
dosage: Adults: 650-1000mg every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 4000mg per day.
side_effects: Rare: rash, allergic reactions, liver damage (with overdose).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Do not exceed recommended dose. Consult a doctor if you have liver disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Naproxen 250mg
description: Naproxen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for pain relief and inflammation reduction.
uses: Used for arthritis, muscle pain, menstrual cramps, gout, and fever reduction.
how_it_works: Inhibits enzymes that produce prostaglandins, reducing pain and inflammation.
dosage: Adults: 250-500mg twice daily. Do not exceed 1500mg per day unless directed by a doctor.
side_effects: Stomach pain, heartburn, nausea, headache, increased risk of bleeding.
precautions: Avoid if you have heart disease, ulcers, or kidney issues. Consult a doctor if pregnant or on other medications.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Vitamin D3 1000IU
description: Vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol) is a fat-soluble vitamin that supports bone health and immune function.
uses: Used to treat or prevent vitamin D deficiency, support bone health, and enhance immune function.
how_it_works: Promotes calcium absorption in the gut and regulates bone remodeling.
dosage: Adults: 1000-2000IU daily, or as directed by a healthcare provider.
side_effects: Rare: nausea, constipation, high calcium levels (with excessive doses).
precautions: Avoid excessive doses. Consult a doctor if you have kidney disease or high calcium levels.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Vitamin C 500mg
description: Vitamin C (ascorbic acid) is a water-soluble vitamin that supports immune function and skin health.
uses: Used to prevent or treat vitamin C deficiency, boost immunity, and promote wound healing.
how_it_works: Acts as an antioxidant, protecting cells from damage and supporting collagen formation.
dosage: Adults: 500-1000mg daily. Do not exceed 2000mg per day unless directed by a doctor.
side_effects: Rare: diarrhea, nausea, stomach cramps (with high doses).
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have kidney stones or are on other medications.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Multivitamin Complex
description: A dietary supplement containing a combination of essential vitamins and minerals.
uses: Used to prevent or treat vitamin deficiencies due to poor diet, illness, or pregnancy.
how_it_works: Provides essential nutrients required for various bodily functions.
dosage: Adults: 1 tablet daily or as directed by a healthcare provider.
side_effects: Rare: upset stomach, headache, unusual taste in mouth.
precautions: Do not exceed the recommended dose. Consult a doctor if pregnant or breastfeeding.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Vitamin B12 1000mcg
description: Vitamin B12 (cyanocobalamin) is a water-soluble vitamin essential for nerve function and red blood cell production.
uses: Used to treat or prevent vitamin B12 deficiency, anemia, and support nerve health.
how_it_works: Supports DNA synthesis and red blood cell formation, and maintains nerve cell function.
dosage: Adults: 500-1000mcg daily, or as prescribed for deficiency.
side_effects: Rare: headache, nausea, allergic reactions.
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have Leberâ€™s disease or are allergic to cobalt.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Omega-3 Fish Oil
description: Omega-3 Fish Oil contains essential fatty acids (EPA and DHA) that support heart and brain health.
uses: Used to support cardiovascular health, reduce inflammation, and promote brain function.
how_it_works: Omega-3 fatty acids reduce triglyceride levels and support cell membrane function.
dosage: Adults: 1000-2000mg daily (containing 300-600mg EPA/DHA), or as directed by a doctor.
side_effects: Fishy aftertaste, nausea, diarrhea, increased bleeding risk (with high doses).
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have bleeding disorders or are taking blood thinners.
storage: Store at room temperature or refrigerate, away from moisture and heat.

name: Lisinopril 10mg
description: Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
uses: Used to manage hypertension, heart failure, and improve survival after a heart attack.
how_it_works: Relaxes blood vessels by inhibiting angiotensin-converting enzyme, lowering blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 10-40mg daily, or as prescribed by a doctor.
side_effects: Dizziness, cough, headache, low blood pressure, kidney issues.
precautions: Avoid if pregnant or if you have a history of angioedema. Monitor kidney function.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Amlodipine 5mg
description: Amlodipine is a calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure and chest pain.
uses: Used for hypertension and angina (chest pain).
how_it_works: Relaxes blood vessels by blocking calcium entry, improving blood flow and reducing heart workload.
dosage: Adults: 5-10mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Swelling, dizziness, flushing, fatigue, headache.
precautions: Avoid if you have severe heart conditions. Consult a doctor if you have liver disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Losartan 50mg
description: Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB) used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
uses: Used for hypertension, heart failure, and to protect kidneys in diabetic patients.
how_it_works: Blocks angiotensin II receptors, relaxing blood vessels and lowering blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 25-100mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Dizziness, fatigue, cough, high potassium levels.
precautions: Avoid if pregnant. Monitor kidney function and potassium levels.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Metoprolol 25mg
description: Metoprolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure, chest pain, and heart failure.
uses: Used for hypertension, angina, and to improve survival after a heart attack.
how_it_works: Blocks beta receptors, slowing heart rate and reducing blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 25-100mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Dizziness, fatigue, slow heart rate, cold hands/feet.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Consult a doctor if you have asthma or diabetes.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Hydrochlorothiazide 25mg
description: Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic used to treat high blood pressure and fluid retention.
uses: Used for hypertension and edema (swelling) caused by heart, liver, or kidney disease.
how_it_works: Increases urine production, reducing fluid and lowering blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 12.5-50mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Dizziness, dehydration, low potassium, muscle cramps.
precautions: Monitor electrolytes. Avoid if you have severe kidney disease or are dehydrated.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Metformin 500mg
description: Metformin is an oral antidiabetic drug used to manage type 2 diabetes.
uses: Used to control blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes and sometimes for polycystic ovary syndrome.
how_it_works: Decreases glucose production in the liver and improves insulin sensitivity.
dosage: Adults: 500-2000mg daily, taken with meals, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, stomach upset, metallic taste, rare lactic acidosis.
precautions: Avoid if you have severe kidney disease. Monitor kidney function.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Glimepiride 1mg
description: Glimepiride is a sulfonylurea used to manage type 2 diabetes.
uses: Used to control blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes.
how_it_works: Stimulates insulin release from the pancreas.
dosage: Adults: 1-4mg daily, taken with breakfast, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Hypoglycemia, weight gain, nausea, allergic reactions.
precautions: Monitor blood sugar. Avoid if allergic to sulfa drugs.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Sitagliptin 100mg
description: Sitagliptin is a DPP-4 inhibitor used to manage type 2 diabetes.
uses: Used to control blood sugar levels in type 2 diabetes, often with diet and exercise.
how_it_works: Increases incretin levels, which stimulate insulin release and reduce glucagon.
dosage: Adults: 100mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Headache, sore throat, nausea, pancreatitis (rare).
precautions: Monitor kidney function. Avoid if you have a history of pancreatitis.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Empagliflozin 10mg
description: Empagliflozin is an SGLT2 inhibitor used to manage type 2 diabetes.
uses: Used to control blood sugar levels and reduce cardiovascular risk in type 2 diabetes.
how_it_works: Increases glucose excretion in urine by inhibiting SGLT2 in the kidneys.
dosage: Adults: 10-25mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Urinary tract infections, dehydration, low blood pressure, genital infections.
precautions: Monitor kidney function. Avoid if you have severe kidney disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Cetirizine 10mg
description: Cetirizine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
uses: Used for hay fever, allergic rhinitis, and hives.
how_it_works: Blocks histamine receptors, reducing allergy symptoms like sneezing and itching.
dosage: Adults: 10mg daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, headache, nausea.
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Use caution if driving or operating machinery.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Loratadine 10mg
description: Loratadine is a non-drowsy antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
uses: Used for hay fever, allergic rhinitis, and hives.
how_it_works: Blocks histamine receptors, reducing allergy symptoms like sneezing and itching.
dosage: Adults: 10mg daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Headache, fatigue, dry mouth, rare drowsiness.
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have liver or kidney disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Fexofenadine 180mg
description: Fexofenadine is a non-drowsy antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
uses: Used for seasonal allergies and chronic hives.
how_it_works: Blocks histamine receptors, reducing symptoms like sneezing, itching, and runny nose.
dosage: Adults: 180mg daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Headache, nausea, dizziness, back pain.
precautions: Avoid with fruit juices. Consult a doctor if you have kidney disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Diphenhydramine 25mg
description: Diphenhydramine is an antihistamine used to relieve allergies and aid sleep.
uses: Used for allergies, motion sickness, and as a sleep aid.
how_it_works: Blocks histamine receptors and has sedative effects.
dosage: Adults: 25-50mg every 4-6 hours for allergies, or 25-50mg at bedtime for sleep.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dry mouth, constipation, dizziness.
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Use caution when driving or operating machinery.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Amoxicillin 250mg
description: Amoxicillin is a penicillin-type antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for infections of the ear, nose, throat, skin, and urinary tract.
how_it_works: Kills bacteria by preventing them from forming cell walls.
dosage: Adults: 250-500mg every 8 hours, or as prescribed. Complete the full course.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, rash, allergic reactions.
precautions: Inform your doctor if you are allergic to penicillins or have kidney disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Azithromycin 250mg
description: Azithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for respiratory infections, skin infections, and sexually transmitted diseases.
how_it_works: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis, stopping bacterial growth.
dosage: Adults: 500mg on day 1, then 250mg daily for 4 days, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain, liver issues (rare).
precautions: Avoid if you have liver disease or are allergic to macrolides.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Ciprofloxacin 500mg
description: Ciprofloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for urinary tract infections, respiratory infections, and skin infections.
how_it_works: Inhibits bacterial DNA replication, killing bacteria.
dosage: Adults: 250-750mg every 12 hours, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, tendon pain, tendon rupture (rare).
precautions: Avoid if you have tendon issues or myasthenia gravis. Consult a doctor if pregnant.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Doxycycline 100mg
description: Doxycycline is a tetracycline antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for acne, respiratory infections, Lyme disease, and malaria prevention.
how_it_works: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis, preventing bacterial growth.
dosage: Adults: 100mg every 12 hours on day 1, then 100mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, sun sensitivity, tooth discoloration (children).
precautions: Avoid if pregnant or breastfeeding. Use sunscreen due to photosensitivity.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Sertraline 50mg
description: Sertraline is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used to treat depression and anxiety.
uses: Used for depression, OCD, panic disorder, PTSD, and social anxiety disorder.
how_it_works: Increases serotonin levels in the brain, improving mood and anxiety.
dosage: Adults: 50-200mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, insomnia, headache, sexual dysfunction, serotonin syndrome (rare).
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for suicidal thoughts, especially in young adults.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Fluoxetine 20mg
description: Fluoxetine is an SSRI antidepressant used to treat depression and other mental health conditions.
uses: Used for depression, OCD, bulimia, and panic disorder.
how_it_works: Increases serotonin levels in the brain, improving mood and behavior.
dosage: Adults: 20-80mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, insomnia, headache, sexual dysfunction, anxiety.
precautions: Monitor for suicidal thoughts. Avoid if taking MAO inhibitors.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Escitalopram 10mg
description: Escitalopram is an SSRI antidepressant used to treat depression and anxiety.
uses: Used for major depressive disorder and generalized anxiety disorder.
how_it_works: Increases serotonin levels in the brain, improving mood and reducing anxiety.
dosage: Adults: 10-20mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, insomnia, fatigue, sexual dysfunction, sweating.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for suicidal thoughts in young adults.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Bupropion 150mg
description: Bupropion is an NDRI antidepressant used to treat depression and aid smoking cessation.
uses: Used for major depressive disorder, seasonal affective disorder, and smoking cessation.
how_it_works: Increases dopamine and norepinephrine levels in the brain, improving mood.
dosage: Adults: 150-300mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Insomnia, dry mouth, headache, seizures (rare).
precautions: Avoid if you have a seizure disorder or eating disorders. Monitor for mood changes.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Venlafaxine 75mg
description: Venlafaxine is an SNRI antidepressant used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
uses: Used for major depressive disorder, generalized anxiety disorder, and social anxiety disorder.
how_it_works: Increases serotonin and norepinephrine levels in the brain, improving mood.
dosage: Adults: 75-225mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, headache, insomnia, high blood pressure, sexual dysfunction.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor blood pressure regularly.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Atorvastatin 10mg
description: Atorvastatin is a statin used to lower cholesterol and reduce cardiovascular risk.
uses: Used to lower LDL cholesterol, prevent heart attack, and stroke in high-risk patients.
how_it_works: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol production in the liver.
dosage: Adults: 10-80mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Muscle pain, liver issues, digestive problems, increased blood sugar.
precautions: Monitor liver function. Avoid if pregnant or breastfeeding.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Simvastatin 20mg
description: Simvastatin is a statin used to lower cholesterol and reduce cardiovascular risk.
uses: Used to lower LDL cholesterol, prevent heart attack, and stroke in high-risk patients.
how_it_works: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol production in the liver.
dosage: Adults: 20-40mg daily, taken in the evening, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Muscle pain, liver issues, digestive problems, increased blood sugar.
precautions: Monitor liver function. Avoid grapefruit juice and pregnancy.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Rosuvastatin 5mg
description: Rosuvastatin is a statin used to lower cholesterol and reduce cardiovascular risk.
uses: Used to lower LDL cholesterol, increase HDL cholesterol, and prevent cardiovascular events.
how_it_works: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol production in the liver.
dosage: Adults: 5-40mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Muscle pain, liver issues, headache, increased blood sugar.
precautions: Monitor liver function. Avoid if pregnant or breastfeeding.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Pravastatin 20mg
description: Pravastatin is a statin used to lower cholesterol and reduce cardiovascular risk.
uses: Used to lower LDL cholesterol and prevent heart attack and stroke.
how_it_works: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol production in the liver.
dosage: Adults: 20-80mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Muscle pain, liver issues, headache, nausea.
precautions: Monitor liver function. Avoid if pregnant or breastfeeding.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Albuterol Inhaler
description: Albuterol is a bronchodilator used to relieve asthma and COPD symptoms.
uses: Used for asthma, bronchospasm, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
how_it_works: Relaxes airway muscles, improving airflow to the lungs.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 puffs every 4-6 hours as needed, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Tremors, nervousness, fast heart rate, throat irritation.
precautions: Monitor heart rate. Avoid overuse. Consult a doctor if you have heart disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from heat and open flame.

name: Fluticasone Inhaler
description: Fluticasone is an inhaled corticosteroid used to manage asthma and COPD.
uses: Used to prevent asthma attacks and manage chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
how_it_works: Reduces inflammation in the airways, improving breathing.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 puffs twice daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Throat irritation, hoarseness, oral thrush, headache.
precautions: Rinse mouth after use to prevent thrush. Avoid if you have untreated infections.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture.

name: Montelukast 10mg
description: Montelukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist used to manage asthma and allergies.
uses: Used for asthma prevention, seasonal allergies, and exercise-induced bronchospasm.
how_it_works: Blocks leukotrienes, reducing airway inflammation and constriction.
dosage: Adults: 10mg daily in the evening, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Headache, stomach pain, fatigue, mood changes (rare).
precautions: Monitor for mood changes. Not for acute asthma attacks.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Levothyroxine 50mcg
description: Levothyroxine is a synthetic thyroid hormone used to treat hypothyroidism.
uses: Used for hypothyroidism, goiter, and thyroid hormone replacement.
how_it_works: Replaces or supplements thyroid hormone, regulating metabolism.
dosage: Adults: 50-200mcg daily, or as prescribed, taken on an empty stomach.
side_effects: Weight changes, hair loss, palpitations, heat intolerance.
precautions: Monitor thyroid function. Avoid if you have untreated adrenal issues.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Liothyronine 25mcg
description: Liothyronine is a synthetic T3 thyroid hormone used to treat hypothyroidism.
uses: Used for hypothyroidism and myxedema coma.
how_it_works: Replaces T3 thyroid hormone, regulating metabolism.
dosage: Adults: 25-75mcg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Palpitations, nervousness, weight loss, heat intolerance.
precautions: Monitor thyroid function. Avoid in patients with heart disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Omeprazole 20mg
description: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used to reduce stomach acid.
uses: Used for GERD, ulcers, and heartburn.
how_it_works: Blocks acid production in the stomach by inhibiting proton pumps.
dosage: Adults: 20-40mg daily, or as prescribed, taken before meals.
side_effects: Headache, nausea, diarrhea, bone fracture risk (long-term).
precautions: Monitor for vitamin B12 deficiency with long-term use. Avoid if allergic to PPIs.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Esomeprazole 40mg
description: Esomeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used to reduce stomach acid.
uses: Used for GERD, ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
how_it_works: Blocks acid production in the stomach by inhibiting proton pumps.
dosage: Adults: 20-40mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Headache, nausea, diarrhea, bone fracture risk (long-term).
precautions: Monitor for magnesium deficiency with long-term use. Avoid if allergic to PPIs.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Ranitidine 150mg
description: Ranitidine is an H2 blocker used to reduce stomach acid.
uses: Used for heartburn, GERD, and ulcers.
how_it_works: Blocks histamine receptors in the stomach, reducing acid production.
dosage: Adults: 150mg twice daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Headache, dizziness, constipation, diarrhea.
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have kidney or liver disease. Note: withdrawn in some markets due to NDMA concerns.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Lansoprazole 30mg
description: Lansoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used to reduce stomach acid.
uses: Used for GERD, ulcers, and erosive esophagitis.
how_it_works: Blocks acid production in the stomach by inhibiting proton pumps.
dosage: Adults: 15-30mg daily, or as prescribed, taken before meals.
side_effects: Headache, nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain.
precautions: Monitor for bone fractures with long-term use. Avoid if allergic to PPIs.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Melatonin 3mg
description: Melatonin is a natural hormone supplement used to improve sleep.
uses: Used for insomnia, jet lag, and sleep disorders.
how_it_works: Regulates the sleep-wake cycle by mimicking the bodyâ€™s natural melatonin.
dosage: Adults: 1-5mg at bedtime, or as directed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, headache, dizziness, nausea.
precautions: Avoid driving after use. Consult a doctor if you have autoimmune disorders.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Zolpidem 10mg
description: Zolpidem is a sedative-hypnotic used to treat insomnia.
uses: Used for short-term treatment of insomnia (difficulty falling asleep).
how_it_works: Enhances GABA activity in the brain, promoting sleep.
dosage: Adults: 5-10mg at bedtime, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, headache, sleepwalking (rare).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Use caution with activities requiring alertness the next day.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Trazodone 50mg
description: Trazodone is an antidepressant used to treat depression and insomnia.
uses: Used for depression and off-label for insomnia.
how_it_works: Increases serotonin levels and has sedative effects.
dosage: Adults: 50-100mg at bedtime for sleep, or as prescribed for depression.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, dry mouth, blurred vision.
precautions: Monitor for suicidal thoughts. Avoid if taking MAO inhibitors.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Hydrocortisone 1%
description: Hydrocortisone is a topical corticosteroid used to reduce skin inflammation.
uses: Used for eczema, psoriasis, and allergic skin reactions.
how_it_works: Reduces inflammation, itching, and redness by mimicking cortisol.
dosage: Adults: Apply a thin layer to affected area 1-4 times daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Skin irritation, thinning, burning, stinging.
precautions: Avoid long-term use on large areas. Do not use on broken skin.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Clotrimazole 1%
description: Clotrimazole is a topical antifungal used to treat fungal skin infections.
uses: Used for athleteâ€™s foot, ringworm, and yeast infections.
how_it_works: Disrupts fungal cell membranes, killing the fungus.
dosage: Adults: Apply a thin layer to affected area twice daily for 2-4 weeks.
side_effects: Skin irritation, burning, redness.
precautions: Avoid contact with eyes. Consult a doctor if no improvement after 4 weeks.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Benzoyl Peroxide 5%
description: Benzoyl peroxide is a topical medication used to treat acne.
uses: Used for mild to moderate acne.
how_it_works: Kills acne-causing bacteria and helps unclog pores.
dosage: Adults: Apply a thin layer to affected area 1-2 times daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Dryness, redness, peeling, burning sensation.
precautions: Avoid contact with eyes and clothing. Use sunscreen due to skin sensitivity.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture.

name: Salicylic Acid 2%
description: Salicylic acid is a topical medication used to treat acne and warts.
uses: Used for acne, warts, and other skin conditions like psoriasis.
how_it_works: Exfoliates skin and unclogs pores, reducing acne and softening warts.
dosage: Adults: Apply to affected area 1-3 times daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Skin irritation, dryness, peeling, stinging.
precautions: Avoid broken skin or large areas. Consult a doctor if pregnant.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Artificial Tears
description: Artificial tears are lubricating eye drops used to relieve dry eyes.
uses: Used for dry eye syndrome and eye irritation.
how_it_works: Mimics natural tears to lubricate and soothe the eyes.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 drops in affected eye(s) as needed, or as directed.
side_effects: Temporary blurred vision, eye irritation, stinging.
precautions: Avoid touching dropper tip to prevent contamination. Remove contact lenses before use.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture.

name: Naphazoline 0.1%
description: Naphazoline is a decongestant eye drop used to relieve eye redness.
uses: Used for eye redness due to allergies or irritation.
how_it_works: Constricts blood vessels in the eye, reducing redness.
dosage: Adults: 1-2 drops in affected eye(s) every 3-4 hours, up to 4 times daily.
side_effects: Eye irritation, stinging, rebound redness (with overuse).
precautions: Avoid prolonged use. Consult a doctor if you have glaucoma or heart disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture.

name: Fluoride Toothpaste
description: Fluoride toothpaste is used to prevent tooth decay and strengthen enamel.
uses: Used for cavity prevention and maintaining oral health.
how_it_works: Strengthens tooth enamel and inhibits bacterial growth in the mouth.
dosage: Adults: Brush teeth twice daily with a pea-sized amount, or as directed.
side_effects: Rare: allergic reactions, tooth discoloration (with overuse in children).
precautions: Avoid swallowing. Supervise children under 6 during brushing.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture.

name: Mouthwash
description: Antiseptic mouthwash is used to reduce oral bacteria and improve oral hygiene.
uses: Used for gingivitis, bad breath, and plaque reduction.
how_it_works: Kills bacteria in the mouth, reducing plaque and gum inflammation.
dosage: Adults: Rinse with 10-20ml for 30 seconds twice daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Mouth irritation, dry mouth, taste changes.
precautions: Avoid swallowing. Not for children under 6 unless directed by a dentist.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from heat and moisture.

name: Diclofenac 50mg
description: Diclofenac is an NSAID used to relieve pain and inflammation.
uses: Used for arthritis, menstrual cramps, and acute pain.
how_it_works: Inhibits prostaglandin production, reducing pain and inflammation.
dosage: Adults: 50mg 2-3 times daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Stomach upset, nausea, heartburn, increased bleeding risk.
precautions: Avoid if you have ulcers, heart disease, or are allergic to NSAIDs.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Tramadol 50mg
description: Tramadol is an opioid analgesic used to treat moderate to severe pain.
uses: Used for acute and chronic pain, such as post-surgical or injury-related pain.
how_it_works: Binds to opioid receptors and inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake.
dosage: Adults: 50-100mg every 4-6 hours, not to exceed 400mg daily.
side_effects: Dizziness, nausea, constipation, seizure risk (rare).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Monitor for dependency or breathing issues.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Codeine 30mg
description: Codeine is an opioid used to treat pain and suppress cough.
uses: Used for mild to moderate pain and as a cough suppressant.
how_it_works: Binds to opioid receptors, reducing pain signals and suppressing cough reflex.
dosage: Adults: 15-60mg every 4-6 hours, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, constipation, nausea, respiratory depression (rare).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Monitor for dependency or breathing issues.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Morphine 15mg
description: Morphine is a strong opioid used to treat severe pain.
uses: Used for severe pain, such as post-surgical or cancer-related pain.
how_it_works: Binds to opioid receptors in the brain, reducing pain perception.
dosage: Adults: 10-30mg every 4 hours, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, constipation, nausea, respiratory depression.
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Monitor for dependency and breathing issues.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Folic Acid 400mcg
description: Folic acid is a B vitamin used to prevent and treat folate deficiency.
uses: Used for folate deficiency, pregnancy, and anemia.
how_it_works: Supports DNA synthesis and red blood cell production.
dosage: Adults: 400-800mcg daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Rare: nausea, bloating, allergic reactions.
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have anemia or vitamin B12 deficiency.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Iron 65mg
description: Iron is a mineral supplement used to treat or prevent iron deficiency anemia.
uses: Used for iron deficiency anemia and during pregnancy to support red blood cell production.
how_it_works: Supports hemoglobin production, enabling oxygen transport in the blood.
dosage: Adults: 65mg elemental iron daily, or as prescribed, taken with food to reduce stomach upset.
side_effects: Constipation, nausea, stomach upset, dark stools.
precautions: Avoid taking with dairy or antacids. Consult a doctor if you have hemochromatosis or gastrointestinal issues.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Calcium 600mg
description: Calcium is a mineral supplement used to support bone health and prevent deficiency.
uses: Used for osteoporosis prevention, calcium deficiency, and during pregnancy.
how_it_works: Provides calcium to support bone strength and muscle function.
dosage: Adults: 600-1200mg daily, or as directed, taken with food.
side_effects: Constipation, bloating, kidney stones (with excessive doses).
precautions: Avoid excessive doses. Consult a doctor if you have kidney disease or high calcium levels.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Magnesium 250mg
description: Magnesium is a mineral supplement used to support muscle and nerve function.
uses: Used for magnesium deficiency, muscle cramps, and heart health.
how_it_works: Supports enzyme function, muscle relaxation, and nerve transmission.
dosage: Adults: 250-400mg daily, or as directed, taken with food.
side_effects: Diarrhea, nausea, stomach upset (with high doses).
precautions: Avoid if you have kidney disease. Consult a doctor if taking other medications.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Zinc 30mg
description: Zinc is a mineral supplement used to support immune function and wound healing.
uses: Used for zinc deficiency, immune support, and wound healing.
how_it_works: Supports immune cell function and enzyme activity.
dosage: Adults: 15-30mg daily, or as directed, taken with food.
side_effects: Nausea, stomach upset, metallic taste, diarrhea.
precautions: Avoid excessive doses. Consult a doctor if you have kidney disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Clarithromycin 500mg
description: Clarithromycin is a macrolide antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for respiratory infections, skin infections, and Helicobacter pylori infections.
how_it_works: Inhibits bacterial protein synthesis, stopping bacterial growth.
dosage: Adults: 250-500mg every 12 hours, or as prescribed, for 7-14 days.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, taste changes, liver issues (rare).
precautions: Avoid if allergic to macrolides. Monitor liver function.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Levofloxacin 500mg
description: Levofloxacin is a fluoroquinolone antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for pneumonia, urinary tract infections, and sinusitis.
how_it_works: Inhibits bacterial DNA replication, killing bacteria.
dosage: Adults: 250-750mg daily, or as prescribed, for 7-14 days.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, tendon pain, tendon rupture (rare).
precautions: Avoid if you have tendon issues or myasthenia gravis. Consult a doctor if pregnant.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Cephalexin 500mg
description: Cephalexin is a cephalosporin antibiotic used to treat bacterial infections.
uses: Used for skin infections, urinary tract infections, and respiratory infections.
how_it_works: Prevents bacterial cell wall formation, killing bacteria.
dosage: Adults: 250-1000mg every 6 hours, or as prescribed, for 7-14 days.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, rash, allergic reactions.
precautions: Avoid if allergic to cephalosporins or penicillins. Complete the full course.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Prednisone 10mg
description: Prednisone is a corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation and suppress the immune system.
uses: Used for arthritis, allergic reactions, autoimmune disorders, and asthma.
how_it_works: Mimics cortisol, reducing inflammation and immune response.
dosage: Adults: 5-60mg daily, or as prescribed, often tapered over time.
side_effects: Weight gain, insomnia, mood changes, increased blood sugar.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for infections and bone health.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Methylprednisolone 4mg
description: Methylprednisolone is a corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation and immune response.
uses: Used for arthritis, allergic reactions, and autoimmune conditions.
how_it_works: Mimics cortisol, suppressing inflammation and immune activity.
dosage: Adults: 4-48mg daily, or as prescribed, often in a tapering dose.
side_effects: Weight gain, insomnia, stomach upset, increased blood sugar.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for infections and bone health.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Lorazepam 1mg
description: Lorazepam is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety and seizures.
uses: Used for anxiety disorders, insomnia due to anxiety, and status epilepticus.
how_it_works: Enhances GABA activity in the brain, producing a calming effect.
dosage: Adults: 1-3mg daily, or as prescribed, often divided into 2-3 doses.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, dependency (with prolonged use).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Monitor for dependency. Not for long-term use.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Alprazolam 0.5mg
description: Alprazolam is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety and panic disorders.
uses: Used for anxiety disorders and panic attacks.
how_it_works: Enhances GABA activity in the brain, reducing anxiety and panic.
dosage: Adults: 0.25-0.5mg 2-3 times daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, confusion, dependency (with prolonged use).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Monitor for dependency. Not for long-term use.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Diazepam 5mg
description: Diazepam is a benzodiazepine used to treat anxiety, muscle spasms, and seizures.
uses: Used for anxiety, muscle spasms, and seizure disorders.
how_it_works: Enhances GABA activity, producing a calming effect and muscle relaxation.
dosage: Adults: 2-10mg 2-4 times daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, fatigue, muscle weakness, dependency (with prolonged use).
precautions: Avoid alcohol. Monitor for dependency. Not for long-term use.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Warfarin 5mg
description: Warfarin is an anticoagulant used to prevent and treat blood clots.
uses: Used for atrial fibrillation, deep vein thrombosis, and pulmonary embolism.
how_it_works: Inhibits vitamin K-dependent clotting factors, reducing blood clot formation.
dosage: Adults: 2-10mg daily, or as prescribed, adjusted based on INR monitoring.
side_effects: Bleeding, bruising, nausea, hair loss.
precautions: Monitor INR regularly. Avoid sudden diet changes or alcohol.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Apixaban 5mg
description: Apixaban is a direct oral anticoagulant used to prevent and treat blood clots.
uses: Used for atrial fibrillation, deep vein thrombosis, and pulmonary embolism.
how_it_works: Inhibits factor Xa, reducing blood clot formation.
dosage: Adults: 2.5-5mg twice daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Bleeding, bruising, nausea, anemia.
precautions: Monitor for bleeding. Avoid if you have severe liver disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Rivaroxaban 20mg
description: Rivaroxaban is a direct oral anticoagulant used to prevent and treat blood clots.
uses: Used for atrial fibrillation, deep vein thrombosis, and post-surgical clot prevention.
how_it_works: Inhibits factor Xa, reducing blood clot formation.
dosage: Adults: 15-20mg daily, or as prescribed, taken with food.
side_effects: Bleeding, bruising, dizziness, liver issues (rare).
precautions: Monitor for bleeding. Avoid if you have severe kidney or liver disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Clopidogrel 75mg
description: Clopidogrel is an antiplatelet drug used to prevent blood clots.
uses: Used to prevent heart attack, stroke, and in patients with stents or heart disease.
how_it_works: Inhibits platelet aggregation, reducing clot formation.
dosage: Adults: 75mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Bleeding, bruising, stomach upset, diarrhea.
precautions: Monitor for bleeding. Avoid if you have active bleeding or liver disease.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Gabapentin 300mg
description: Gabapentin is an anticonvulsant used to treat seizures and nerve pain.
uses: Used for epilepsy, neuropathic pain, and restless legs syndrome.
how_it_works: Modulates nerve activity, reducing seizures and pain signals.
dosage: Adults: 300-1200mg three times daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, fatigue, weight gain.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for mood changes or suicidal thoughts.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Pregabalin 75mg
description: Pregabalin is an anticonvulsant used to treat nerve pain and seizures.
uses: Used for neuropathic pain, fibromyalgia, and partial seizures.
how_it_works: Reduces nerve excitability, decreasing pain and seizure activity.
dosage: Adults: 75-300mg twice daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Dizziness, drowsiness, weight gain, blurred vision.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for mood changes or dependency.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Levetiracetam 500mg
description: Levetiracetam is an anticonvulsant used to treat seizures.
uses: Used for partial-onset, myoclonic, and tonic-clonic seizures in epilepsy.
how_it_works: Modulates neurotransmitter release, reducing seizure activity.
dosage: Adults: 500-1500mg twice daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Drowsiness, dizziness, fatigue, mood changes.
precautions: Monitor for mood changes or suicidal thoughts. Avoid abrupt discontinuation.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Lamotrigine 100mg
description: Lamotrigine is an anticonvulsant used to treat seizures and bipolar disorder.
uses: Used for epilepsy and maintenance treatment of bipolar I disorder.
how_it_works: Stabilizes neuronal membranes, reducing seizure activity and mood swings.
dosage: Adults: 25-200mg daily, or as prescribed, titrated slowly.
side_effects: Rash, dizziness, headache, serious skin reactions (rare).
precautions: Monitor for rash. Avoid abrupt discontinuation.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Propranolol 40mg
description: Propranolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and anxiety.
uses: Used for hypertension, angina, tremors, and performance anxiety.
how_it_works: Blocks beta receptors, slowing heart rate and reducing blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 40-120mg daily, or as prescribed, often divided into doses.
side_effects: Fatigue, dizziness, slow heart rate, cold hands/feet.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Consult a doctor if you have asthma or diabetes.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Atenolol 50mg
description: Atenolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and heart conditions.
uses: Used for hypertension, angina, and post-heart attack management.
how_it_works: Blocks beta-1 receptors, reducing heart rate and blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 25-100mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Fatigue, dizziness, slow heart rate, cold extremities.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Consult a doctor if you have asthma or diabetes.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Carvedilol 6.25mg
description: Carvedilol is a beta-blocker used to treat heart failure and high blood pressure.
uses: Used for heart failure, hypertension, and post-heart attack left ventricular dysfunction.
how_it_works: Blocks alpha and beta receptors, reducing blood pressure and heart workload.
dosage: Adults: 6.25-25mg twice daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Dizziness, fatigue, low blood pressure, weight gain.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Monitor for low blood pressure.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Spironolactone 25mg
description: Spironolactone is a diuretic used to treat fluid retention and high blood pressure.
uses: Used for heart failure, edema, hypertension, and hyperaldosteronism.
how_it_works: Blocks aldosterone, increasing water and sodium excretion while retaining potassium.
dosage: Adults: 25-100mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: High potassium, dizziness, breast tenderness, rash.
precautions: Monitor potassium levels. Avoid if you have kidney disease or hyperkalemia.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Furosemide 40mg
description: Furosemide is a loop diuretic used to treat fluid retention and high blood pressure.
uses: Used for edema due to heart failure, liver disease, or kidney disease, and hypertension.
how_it_works: Inhibits sodium and water reabsorption in the kidneys, increasing urine output.
dosage: Adults: 20-80mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Dehydration, low potassium, dizziness, hearing loss (rare).
precautions: Monitor electrolytes. Avoid if you have severe kidney disease or dehydration.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Pantoprazole 40mg
description: Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used to reduce stomach acid.
uses: Used for GERD, ulcers, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome.
how_it_works: Blocks acid production in the stomach by inhibiting proton pumps.
dosage: Adults: 40mg daily, or as prescribed, taken before meals.
side_effects: Headache, diarrhea, nausea, bone fracture risk (long-term).
precautions: Monitor for magnesium deficiency with long-term use. Avoid if allergic to PPIs.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Famotidine 20mg
description: Famotidine is an H2 blocker used to reduce stomach acid.
uses: Used for heartburn, GERD, and ulcers.
how_it_works: Blocks histamine receptors in the stomach, reducing acid production.
dosage: Adults: 20-40mg daily, or as directed.
side_effects: Headache, dizziness, constipation, diarrhea.
precautions: Consult a doctor if you have kidney disease. Monitor for prolonged use.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Bisoprolol 5mg
description: Bisoprolol is a beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure.
uses: Used for hypertension and heart failure.
how_it_works: Blocks beta-1 receptors, reducing heart rate and blood pressure.
dosage: Adults: 5-20mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Fatigue, dizziness, slow heart rate, cold extremities.
precautions: Avoid abrupt discontinuation. Consult a doctor if you have asthma or diabetes.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Allopurinol 100mg
description: Allopurinol is used to treat gout and high uric acid levels.
uses: Used for gout prevention and kidney stones caused by uric acid.
how_it_works: Inhibits xanthine oxidase, reducing uric acid production.
dosage: Adults: 100-300mg daily, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Rash, nausea, liver issues, severe allergic reactions (rare).
precautions: Monitor liver function. Avoid if you have a history of severe reactions.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Colchicine 0.6mg
description: Colchicine is used to treat and prevent gout flares.
uses: Used for acute gout attacks and familial Mediterranean fever.
how_it_works: Reduces inflammation by inhibiting microtubule formation in white blood cells.
dosage: Adults: 1.2mg at first sign of gout flare, followed by 0.6mg one hour later, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Nausea, diarrhea, abdominal pain, bone marrow suppression (rare).
precautions: Avoid if you have severe kidney or liver disease. Monitor for toxicity.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.

name: Ondansetron 4mg
description: Ondansetron is an antiemetic used to prevent nausea and vomiting.
uses: Used for nausea and vomiting due to chemotherapy, radiation, or surgery.
how_it_works: Blocks serotonin receptors in the brain and gut, reducing nausea.
dosage: Adults: 4-8mg every 8 hours, or as prescribed.
side_effects: Headache, constipation, fatigue, QT prolongation (rare).
precautions: Monitor for heart rhythm changes. Avoid if allergic to 5-HT3 antagonists.
storage: Store at room temperature, away from moisture and heat.
